Get Started

Introduction

Get started with Swiftly, the newest framework for building responsive, mobile-first sites. Accompanied by detailed documentation on usage and a template starter page.

Follow the steps to get all pieces in place.

Step 1 - Installation

Download Swiftly from Github.
Use Download button or go to Github and search for our repository.

The download includes the following precompiled CSS, SASS files, Javascript files and Icons/images needed for the framework.


CSS:

  • swiftly.css
  • swiftly.min.css
  • swiftly.css.map
  • swiftly.min.css.map

Javascript:

  • swiftly-slideshow.js
  • swiftly-tabs.js
  • swiftly.js

Step 2 - Set up

  • All required tags and attributes should be specified in the meta and head tags, for responsive beahvior.
  • All required links to CSS, Javascript should be specified. Links to Swiftly files should appear before your local files. This would allow your styles to take precedence, in case of overrriding or modifying framework styles.
  • It is preferred to connect to swiftly.min.css as it is minified and will add less weight to your pages.
  • Make sure the sorce path is correct, according to your folder setup.
Links

Link to font awesome CDN

Link to google fonts placed in head section, even before swiftly.css files.

CSS link to be placed in head before other stylesheets

Javascript link to be placed at the bottom of body tag.

Step 3 - HTML starter template

Be sure to have your pages set up with the latest design and development standards. That means using an HTML5 doctype and including a viewport meta tag for proper responsive behaviors. Put it all together and your pages should look like this:

Javascript link to be placed at the bottom of body tag.

Step 4 - Follow Documentation

Documentation comes with examples on how to use the framework classes.
